title: Adjust global background image positioning offsets

requirements.summary: Shift the global body background image 2in down and 3in left on mobile (<768px) and desktop (>=768px) by updating background-position values in frontend/src/index.css while keeping background-size: cover and existing asset references unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: On viewports <768px, the computed `body` background position results in the background appearing shifted ~2in down and ~3in left relative to the prior `center top` position.
On viewports >=768px, the computed `body` background position results in the background appearing shifted ~2in down and ~3in left relative to the prior `center center` position.

No changes are made to background filenames/paths (e.g., `mawalking-user-bg-mobile.dim_1080x1920.*` and `mawalking-user-bg.dim_1920x1080.*` remain referenced), and the background still renders and covers the viewport.

file_operations.description: Update `body { background-position: ... }` for mobile default from `center top` to an offset position equivalent to ~3in left and ~2in down (e.g., x: calc(50% - 3in), y: calc(0% + 2in)), and update the desktop `@media (min-width: 768px) { body { background-position: ... } }` from `center center` to an offset position (e.g., x: calc(50% - 3in), y: calc(50% + 2in)). Keep `background-size: cover` and all existing background-image references unchanged.
